description:
The trails in the area appear to be under development and the trail head can be a bit hard to find as it is down the road a little bit from the trails sign. 
You can take the Smallwood and Bigwood trails to create a loop. The trails are heavy forested. Smallwood has a few short steeper sections. Bigwood appears to be developed as a downhill for mountain bikes.Smallwood continues on along the ridge from that mapped. Another map on Trailspeak.com shows this option.
directions: From the Taghum bridge (Nelson side--8km from the city) drive west for 5.3km. Turn right onto Beasley Road. At 0.6km right onto Queen Victoria Rd (unpaved). At 1.1km the road becomes Smallwood Creek Forest Service Rd. At 3.0 go left onto Garrity Creek FSR trailhead signed). 5.5km fork right onto Garritt Connector (trailhead signed). At 6.2 reach the trail head.
title: Smallwood and Bigwood Loop
